title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 65.4 - Narcotics
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 65.4 - Narcotics

State Regulations

To be certified to administer or prescribe narcotics as
authorized under section
7001
of the

Education Law, a podiatrist licensed to practice in New York shall
either: (a) have graduated from a
college of podiatric medicine on or after May 1, 1972; or
(b) have graduated from a college of
podiatric medicine prior to May 1, 1972 and successfully completed a 12-hour
program of study of narcotics as applicable to podiatric practice offered by a
college of podiatric medicine and approved by the department. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
65.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
